intro: Burckella macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered burckella, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the stems are often hairy. It thrives in wetlands and along streambanks, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
